intro: Antidesma poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar antidesma, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Antidesma poilanei is often found in dry forest or scrubland environments.
